attributes.action: require school transport providers to supply booster seats for smaller children during school outings.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Research has shown that children restrained by a poorly adjusted 3 point seat-belt are very likely to suffer serious neck injury in a crash.

This injury results from a victim sitting too low for the strap, with it lying across the throat of the child and not the chest/shoulder. A cheap and easily fitted standard booster seat raises the child to an appropriate height significantly increasing safety.

transport with only lap-belts fitted should be immediately withdrawn from service as these restraints invariably cause severe spinal/abdominal injury in a heavy collision.
